intro: Ceterach cordatum, commonly known as the flat seagrass, is a marine plant found in shallow coastal waters. It belongs to the family Zosteraceae and is characterized by its ribbon-like, blade-shaped leaves. The plant forms dense underwater meadows that provide habitat and nursery grounds for various marine species. Ceterach cordatum is typically found in sandy or muddy substrates in temperate regions. It plays an important role in stabilizing sediments and maintaining coastal ecosystems.
